quest.name: It's Dwarfin' Time
journal: A Tomran dwarf finds himself far from home. Far by Tomran standards, that is.

Regitt has made the arduous─but not especially long─journey to Wright in search of Ronitt, the young engineering prodigy whom you once taught to lali-ho. It seems that he has set his sights on the Crystarium, where he hopes to track you down, for reasons that are as yet unclear. You kindly agree to accompany Regitt and unravel the mysteries surrounding Ronitt's sudden departure.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You and Regitt eventually come across a Crystarium guard who claims to have seen a dwarf not too long ago, over at the Crystalline Mean. Wasting no time, you decide to pursue your one and only lead as to Ronitt's whereabouts.

Ronitt is, as Regitt had predicted, cowering in a corner, seemingly overwhelmed by the presence of so many “big folk” in one place. Before long, Katliss of the Mean comes to make the acquaintance of the two dwarves, which in turn prompts Ronitt to reveal why he has journeyed to the Crystarium. Until recently, he was under the impression that you were little more than a passing traveler. Having been informed of your heroic achievements, however, he is now determined to perform great deeds of his own, so as not to be outdone by you, his dear friend. As he cannot hope to compete with you in terms of martial prowess, he instead hopes to improve the lives of the various peoples of the realm through his skills as an engineer. Much to his surprise─and no small amount of chagrin─you reveal that you too have an affinity for crafting, to which Ronitt responds by suggesting that the two of you cooperate in helping the Crystalline Mean. Katliss explains that roving sin eaters have taken to attacking merchant caravans of late, and she is looking for a means of transporting their goods across Lakeland without placing the traders at risk. Ronitt toys with the idea of using his existing line of automata as a possible solution, but comes to the conclusion that major improvements must be carried out, necessitating the need for a large and fully furnished workshop. Katliss then offers the use of an area in Lakeland once designated to the Mean, though you will first need to gain the permission of Lorathia, the land owner, who is known to frequent the baths at Clearmelt.

Ronitt and Regitt get off to a bumpy start with Lorathia, who is not one to tolerate any of their endearing dwarven impertinence. Upon hearing of the plan to upgrade Ronitt's automata, she immediately dismisses the idea, as the current design lacks both the storage capacity for transporting cargo and the weaponry needed to fend off sin eaters. It then dawns on Ronitt that he has been carrying the solution about his person the entire time, and produces from his pocket a blueprint for a tanklike vehicle originally designed by his ancestor and famed engineer, Watts, which he aptly dubbed the “Rolling Tankard.” With room inside for large quantities of goods and a cannon capable of dealing with threats from a distance, all that remains is to actually build one. A task easier said than done, it would seem, as the designs do not show any of its inner workings. Not one to be discouraged, Ronitt claims he will be able to employ modern techniques to finish what would have been impossible in Watts's day. Lorathia eventually caves in and allows the use of her land, mainly out of curiosity, as she too was once an engineer. Ronitt goes ahead to survey the site of the new workshop, with automaton in tow, while Regitt heads back to Tomra to recruit volunteers to assist in building the tanks.

The plot of land on which you and Ronitt will build the workshop has promise, but there is much to be done before tank production can begin. There are a number of basic supplies that must be procured, though thankfully, Ronitt has already had his automaton gather some raw materials. Eager to see your artisanal skills in practice, he tasks you with putting together the first essential pieces of what will eventually become the workshop.

With the workshop─now known as Watts's Anvil─complete and Regitt returned from Tomra with a host of dwarven assistants, the complicated task of designing and constructing a prototype tank can begin. Your role will initially be to lend Regitt a hand in crafting various parts and materials, while Ronitt channels his engineering prowess into his next masterpiece.
objectives: Speak with Regitt in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Bugger my beard! You scared the life out of me!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Phew... For a moment, I thought you were a hobgoblin. Seems being so far from Tomra has got me jumping at shadows. Hold on. I know you...

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)You're the one who was helping Ronitt! As for me, the name's Regitt. I forgot to introduce myself before, but I was there when that off little lad gave his first proper lali-ho. What? You don't remember me?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: In all fairness, the fact you're covered from head to toe in identical outfits does make it a little difficult to tell one dwarf from the next...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Well, they have their ways and we have ours. Anyway, it's wonderful to see you again, Forename. Regitt was just asking us for directions.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)I'd almost forgotten about that! Actually, I was on my way to...what was it called? Crystaltown? No, no, that's not it. Something to do with crystals... Gah! Why can't I remember the sodding name!?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: You see, Ronitt is nowhere to be found. He did leave a note behind in Tomra, though.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)Yes! The letter! I have it right here.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text:
(-Ronitt's Letter-)To whoever might be concerned,
I am off to the Crystarium to find my first and best friend, Forename.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text:
(-Ronitt's Letter-)If the chief asks where I've gone, just make something up. The automata will take care of my work, so he should have no reason to complain. Oh, and don't forget to feed them while I'm away! With coal, that is.
Bye!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)That's what it says, anyway. That boy may have mastered the fine art of a good, old-fashioned lali-ho, but that won't get him very far in the...Crystarea, or whatever it's called.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Yes, and even if the opening pleasantries go as planned, it's what comes after that matters most. He'd be the first to admit that polite conversation isn't exactly his forte...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Since he went there looking for Forename, maybe the two of you could go and find him before he gets into─or causes─any trouble.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)That reminds me, will Ronitt being away lead to any difficulties in the “rock phosphate for grog” arrangement between our villages?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: The Orehound Ogre he built seems to be going about its work as normal, even without him here to operate it, so I think we'll be fine for the time being.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)All right, that settles it. We're off to find Ronitt! Although, I should probably point out that this is actually the first time I've gone more than a malm or so outside of Tomra. I'm counting on you, so please try to keep the mishaps and misadventure to a bare minimum!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: (-Regitt-)Not that I'm scared, mind you! Ho ho, not one bit... Ahem! Without any further ado, let's make haste for the Crystaforium!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: And we wish you both a safe journey to the Crystarium! Hee hee!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: All by himself? I can't see that ending well...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: That's...unexpected, to say the least.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I must admit, I don't envy you having to keep an eye on not one, but two dwarves in a place like the Crystarium. Who knows what sort of trouble they'll get into?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I have a feeling it won't take long to find him. For better or worse, dwarves have a habit of drawing attention wherever they go!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: I've never seen so many people in one place! Unfortunately, not one of them is our errant engineer.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Where could he be? I wouldn't be surprised if he's whimpering in some corner, wishing he'd never come here. With all these big folk walking about, he's probably scared one of them'll trip over him!

dialogue.name: CITYGUARD
dialogue.text: Well, slap my arse and call me a phooka! You're the second honest-to-gods dwarf I've seen tonightthis morningtoday!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Really!? So, where was the first?

dialogue.name: CITYGUARD
dialogue.text: Over at the Mean, playing hide-and-seek by the looks of it. Or maybe he was just lost?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: That's him, it's got to be! Come on, Forename, let's go and nab him before he runs off again.

dialogue.name: CITYGUARD
dialogue.text: Another dwarf? Or is it the same one I saw before?

dialogue.name: CITYGUARD
dialogue.text: I remember when dwarves were just something you'd only hear about in stories. But now, I'm seeing them all over the place!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: So, this is the Mean, eh? From the name, I thought it'd be full of scowling faces, but they all seem quite friendly. Anyway, where'd Ronitt get to?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Ha! Found him!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: So many of them... So soddin' tall... I wish Forename were here!

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON03896
dialogue.text: (-Ronitt's Automaton-)<beep> Forename detected.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: WALDEN
dialogue.text: Oi! Watch it, short arse!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: So, when you heard that Forename is staying in the Crystarium, you came here looking for herhim? That's quite the journey for one so young.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Gettin' here was easy! Startin' conversation's what's hard. Every time I try givin' someone a good, ol'-fashioned lali-ho, they look at me like I'm daft or somethin'!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Never mind all that─you found Forename in the end. Or shehe found you, more like. Come to think of it, why were you looking for herhim in the first place?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: It's simple, really. I always thought Forename was just a...I dunno, helpful traveler or some such, but the chief tells me shehe's a hero who risked life and limb to save the world!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: When I heard that, I thought that it's only right that I do the same! Trouble is, I'm not sure where to start. But I'm not goin' back to Tomra until I find a way to prove myself your equal!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: And while I'm not much of a fighter, there are other ways I can help those in need. Because unlike the rest of my village, who can't think beyond their next pint of ale, I've got big dreams! Ambitions!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Now, now. There's nothing wrong with a well-earned drink or ten after a hard day's work, but that's besides the point. How can you hope to compete with someone like Forename?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: You might be known as the greatest warrior the world's ever seen...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: But there's one thing I can do better than you: craftin'!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ha! I'm a crafter too, you fluffy-bearded nincompoop!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Actually, I've been known to dabble in artisanry myself.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Whaaat!? You must be joking!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Why, Forename has been putting herhis skills as an [Job]a [Job] to help around the Mean for some time now.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Now there's a surprise. Had I known sooner, I'd have asked you to help around the Mean. If you have a moment to spare, come and see me. I've all sorts of tasks lined up for a master craftswomanman.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Trust me to make friends with one of those annoyin' people who's good at everythin'... I suppose there's no need to make it into a competition, though. Why don't we, uh...what's the word...cooperate? There might be someone around here who needs our help.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: How about you, miss? Got anythin' that needs mendin'? Or maybe one of my patented automata can carry out a few menial tasks?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Hmm... Where to begin?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: We did receive a report a few days ago of a caravan of merchants being attacked by roving sin eaters, not far from Sullen.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: While they were able to escape without any casualties, they had no choice but to abandon almost all of the produce they were transporting. I fear it's only a matter of time until it happens again. Is there anything you can do?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Sin eaters? Bugger that.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: This Fetchomatic Mechatoad might come in handy. A few extra spiky bits should do the trick. Hmm... On second thought, it might take more than that. I'll need somewhere to use as a workshop to carry out some modifications...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: You mean to say you build these yourselves? It certainly is...imposing. In a way only a three-wheeled mechanical frog can be.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Now there's a fine compliment if ever I heard one! I think... This example of dwarven engineering was lovingly crafted by young Ronitt, here. He's a descendant of the great blacksmith Watts, and well on his way to becoming the pride of Tomra in his own right!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Yes, judging by the quality of his work, I can see why.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: In fact, I have a proposal. If you're willing to lend us your expertise, we can arrange space for you to use as a workshop.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: When I say “space,” that's essentially all there is. We'd planned to build a storehouse near the Ostall Imperative, but we had to divert our resources elsewhere, and it was never completed. It seems to me you'd put it to good use.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: After all, a friend of Forename's is a friend of ours.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: That's very generous of you, miss! I'll turn that place into a first-class workshop in two shakes of a newborn's beard!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Excellent. I'll inform those at the Imperative, so they aren't too surprised when automata start appearing out of the blue. I suggest you make yourselves known to Lorathia, who owns the land. She's a regular at the Clearmelt springs, so try there first.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Sounds like some meetin' and greetin' is in order. I reckon it'll go a lot smoother if you're there to cover for me in the likely event I put my foot in it somehow. I also have no bloody idea how to get there. So, lead the way!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Please give Lorathia my regards, and do try not to be discouraged if she seems a little...irascible at first.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: So, this is Clearmelt, eh? Funny name for a bunch of rocks and a couple of ponds, if you ask me. More importantly, where's that Lorathia person?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: You there! Old crone! I'm lookin' for Lorathia. You know where she is?

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Call me an old crone again and I'll rip that silly beard off and shove it down your throat, you mouthy little gobshite.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)But if it's Lorathia you're after, you're looking at her. What do you want?

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Katliss sent you, did she? Hmm... If she thinks you're all right, that's good enough for me.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)So, tell me, what are you planning to make in this workshop of yours? And don't go thinking you can impress me with a load of technical jargon. I was an engineer myself, you know.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: I'm gonna modify this here automaton so that it can transport goods and keep them safe from sin eaters.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Pah! It won't be transporting much of anything with those stubby little arms, let alone fend off attackers.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)And even if it could store goods in its torso, by the time it's done windmilling into the bastards, all those wares will have been shaken to buggery. Good luck to the poor sods who have to sell that.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Yeah, but the windmillin's the best part!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Ronitt, the old woman has a point, you know.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Less of the “old,” or I'll use that beard of yours to scrub the baths, with the rest of you still attached!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: So, we need a way to carry as much as possible while strikin' the sin eaters from a distance...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: That's it! Everyone, gather round!

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Wicked white... It's so old, the ink's probably the only thing holding it together.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: The design's from the days before the Flood, the brainchild of the great Watts himself. It's a self-propelled transportation device, armed to the teeth. I call it...

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: The Rollin' Tankard!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Its thick iron shell keeps the cargo inside safe and sound, while the cannon blasts any attackers to smithereens!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: What an amazing coincidence that you've had the perfect solution in your pocket this whole time! Even before you knew what the problem was!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: This ain't no coincidence. Ever since I found a bunch of blueprints in a tightly locked safe back when I was little, I've taken them with me wherever I go. Never know when Watts's ideas might come in handy!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: 'Course, I'm not just gonna make one of these, oh no. I'll make a whole bunch of 'em, and send them all over Norvrandt. Soon everyone'll see how great dwarven engineerin' really is!

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)But this only shows how it should look from the outside, with no mention of the inner workings. Are you sure you can pull this off?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: I'd bet my beard on it!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: And to be honest, dwarven technology's come a long way since Watts's time. He probably didn't design the insides because there was no way to actually make somethin' like this back then.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Luckily, we've got my skills to bring Watts's ideas to life. I'll have a prototype up and runnin' in no time!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Listen, Ronitt. You're not the only one who knows how to swing a hammer around here. If we combine our efforts, it'll be ready even sooner.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Cheers mate, 'preciate it.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)I must say, I'd be interested to see how this all turns out. I'll let you use my land, as long as you don't turn it into a smoldering crater.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: You won't regret this! But if we're to build a workshop, we'll need a few more pairs of hands. I'll head back to Tomra and round up some volunteers.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)Hold it right there!

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)If this place is going to be overrun with dwarves, at least give me some way to tell you apart.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: (-Lorathia-)How am I meant to know who's who if you all dress like that?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Not sure if you realize this, madam, but we dwarves don't exactly have extensive wardrobes. But, in the interests of a smooth-running operation, I'll ask my friend Karutt if there's anything we can do.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Pff. So much for helpin'. More like “bugger off back to Tomra and leave poor Ronitt to do everythin' by himself!” Well, you're still here, so you can give me a hand instead. Let's go and take a look at this plot of land, shall we?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: These hot springs look awfully...hot. I'd go for a dip myself, but I'm worried my head would boil inside my helmet! Taking it off first is out of the question, obviously.

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: Nothing better than a long soak in the springs, and Clearmelt has the best for malms around. It's a shame I can't have the whole place to myself!

dialogue.name: LORATHIA
dialogue.text: That land used to belong to a relative of mine who moved to the Crystarium to get away from the sin eaters. Since then, I've been at a loss as to what to do with it. I'm not exactly inundated with potential tenants, as you can well imagine.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Welcome to the workshop! Or “workshop-to-be,” I suppose I should call it. Either way, this is where Watts's vision will become reality.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Although, I have to admit, it's not gonna be as easy as I've made out. Havin' you here does make the task seem less dauntin', though.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: And even though I was a bit miffed at first to hear you're into craftin' as well─stealin' my thunder and all that─I'm glad we've got somethin' in common.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If you can lend a hand between whatever it is the Warrior of Darkness does the rest of the time, it'd mean the world to me.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: So, what do you say, Forename? Will you help me?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What the world needs now is tanks, sweet tanks. Of course I'll help.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No. You talked yourself into this. Build your own damned tanks.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Ah. Not quite the answer I was hopin' for. Well, if you change your mind, you know where to find me.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Phew! I was worried you was gonna say no for a moment there! Now, let's make some tanks!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Erm, but before that, there are a few things we need to get in order. We won't get much work done without somethin' at least resemblin' a workshop.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If you're in the mood for helpin', maybe you could rustle me up some basic parts? I've got a list of everythin' I need. Anyone with even a passin' interest in metalworkin' should be able to manage it, so I'm sure you'll be fine!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If you're in the mood for helpin', maybe you could rustle me up some basic supplies? I've got a list of everythin' I need. Anyone with even a passin' interest in handicrafts' should be able to manage it, so I'm sure you'll be fine!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If you're in the mood for helpin', maybe you could rustle me up a few concoctions? I've got a list of everythin' I need. Anyone who's so much as brewed a pot of tea should be able to manage it, so I'm sure you'll be fine!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: As another example of my incredible foresight, I've already had the Fetchomatic Mechatoad collect a load of random─I mean, potentially very useful─materials on the way over. This should be enough.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: If you somehow manage to bugger it up, don't worry. We've got plenty more. I'll be takin' care of the rest of the preparations, so come and see me when you're done.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Run into some difficulties, did you? Not to worry, there's more where that came from. In the automaton's belly, that is.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Run into some difficulties, did you? Not to worry, there's more where that came from. In the automaton's belly, that is.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Run into some difficulties, did you? Not to worry, there's more where that came from. In the automaton's belly, that is.

dialogue.text: <beep> <boop>

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> <boop>

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for materials acknowledged.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for materials acknowledged.

dialogue.name: AUTOMATON
dialogue.text: <beep> Request for ingredients acknowledged.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: All done? Let's see what you've brought me, then!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Ah. I gotta say, I wasn't expectin' it to be quite this good. Not showin' off, are you?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Me and the Mechatoad'll take care of the rest, so you go and put your feet up for a bit. Don't want you takin' all the credit, now!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: There you are! Welcome to Watts's Anvil!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: The two of you did all this!? I can't believe it!

dialogue.name: KARUTT
dialogue.text: I-Is that you, Ronitt? Why, I...I hardly recognized you! Have you done something with your beard?

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Well spotted, Karutt!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Accordin' to the legends, Watts had a brown beard and white horns. Seein' as I'm his descendant, I thought I'd follow suit!

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: Now that we've got a proper workshop, we can get started on makin' a prototype of the Rollin' Tankard.

dialogue.name: RONITT
dialogue.text: To tell the truth, I'm not used to havin' this sort of pressure. Still, I've got you and the others here to do the heavy lif─essential tasks, so I'm sure everythin' will go exactly as planned!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Speaking of essential tasks, I'll be handling the supply of the various parts and whatnot, so come and see me when you're ready to show us those skills of yours.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Ronitt and his fellow dwarves have thrown themselves wholeheartedly into their newest enterprise, namely, to provide trundling death machines for the needy.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Friendly reputation with Watts's Anvil.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Dwarf tribal quests are now available from Regitt at Watts's Anvil.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you may now purchase wares from Mizutt.
